TopicTitle: Will we be able to construct new KSC's?

Articles.Content: I was wondering if in some future update, Squad was planning to add the ability to construct KSC\'s on other bodies.

There have been mentions where KSC buildings will be vulnerable to damage by debris or propelled rockets during launch accidents or other incidents in the campaign mode if not also sandbox. Between the ability to repair that, and also mentions of different sorts of launch towers, pads, and assembly buildings for your customizable needs, I would see that idea will be very feasible. I would also be a strong proponent, myself, as it would be wondrous to be able to build a launch base on the Mun. For one, it would help immensely to get a better feel for physics and handling there, as well as making interplanetary missions much more affordable. If you only need to escape from the Mun\'s gravity well to get to the other planets, you won\'t need as much as from Kerbin.
Other bodies? I just want one on the north pole...

I do hope this will happen!! But I think if we get KSC\'s on other bodies (mun, minmus etc.), they would only have the parts that you deliver to them in a cargo trip -- otherwise it would be a bit too unrealistic

Cheers,

Dom
I hope we can build Helium 3 mining facilities on the Mun.

I do hope this will happen!! But I think if we get KSC\'s on other bodies (mun, minmus etc.), they would only have the parts that you deliver to them in a cargo trip -- otherwise it would be a bit too unrealistic

Cheers,

Dom

that would be awesome, id also love to have to make trips to keep it stocked up with parts and fuel.

Yes we will be able to build KSC\'s in the future. But before that, we need docking. Which could deliver cargo and fuel and parts so we can build with it. For example: Build a station that will orbit the mun, then fly to it all the time and send cargo. Then land at your base and start building. And as someone said, it will be easier to get to other planets from there since theres less gravity
